Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.29910626] Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC=20 μM), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 33591 (MIC=10 μM), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 43300 (MIC=10 μM), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC BAA41 (MIC=10 μM), Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 19433 (MIC=15 μM), Enterococcus faecalis ATCC BAA2365 (MIC=5 μM), Staphylococcus epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC=10 μM), Enterococcus faecium ATCC BAA2316 (MIC=5 μM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=10 μM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC=20 μM), Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 19606 (MIC=10 μM), Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC=2.5 μM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC BAA2114 (MIC=25 μM), Escherichia coli ATCC BAA2452 (MIC=10 μM)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.29910626] 0% haemolysis at 5 μM, 0% haemolysis at 10 μM, 0% haemolysis at 25 μM, 0% haemolysis at 40 μM, 0% haemolysis at 55 μM, 0% haemolysis at 75 μM, 0% haemolysis at 80 μM, 2.1% haemolysis at 100 μM against human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.29910626] IC50 = 61.9±0.18 μM against HEK293.IC50 = 64.9±1.01 μM against Vero.
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The peptide adopts a conformational structure with 90 % alpha helix.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against the Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

Literature.Title: Hybridization and antibiotic synergism as a tool for reducing the cytotoxicity of antimicrobial peptides.
Literature.Author: Almaaytah A, Qaoud MT, Abualhaijaa A, Al-Balas Q, Alzoubi KH.
